comments.body: Rather than having the default here, can we have the default be the command-line arg's default? That way it would show in the usage information.
Re-cap of side conversation.  The rub is that we can't used `defaultsTo:` since when it gets called, `ArtifactStore.flutterRoot` isn't set yet.  Anyway, we agreed to revisit if needed.
I'm worried that this won't act as overrides but will entirely replace the env vars. Perhaps init it to a copy of the current env. vars?
Reading this: https://api.dartlang.org/stable/1.16.1/dart-io/Process/run.html, it looks like it defaults to just overridding the specified vars, so looks ok.
docs say that if `incldeParentEnvironment` is true (default), it will include the parent process' environment, giving precedence to the overrides for name conflicts -- so we should be good.
we really should avoid adding more ways to run subprocesses... I don't suppose I can get you to embrace a yak shave that involves cleaning up this file, can I? :-)
Agreed but I'm thinking more about instance field initializers...
We should probably move away from "Sync" ways of running subprocesses, by the way, since they block progress meters.
Oh wait, I see you've anticipated my above question!
Might be nice to have a simple unit test that verifies these stages happen in a specific order. More as a regression test than anything else.
Done
We're actually trying to remove methods from this file to reduce the API surface.  Can you just inline this into `android_workflow.dart` (or make it a private function in there)?

I can, but I don't think that's an effective strategy for improving the maintainability of the code.  At least for now, most of the subprocess invocation goes through that file, ugly or no.  I don't think people are extending the flutter tool itself using private package directories (?) so I would think the tool would better served by having as much of the ugly co-located as possible.

If I'm wrong about that though and the API surface is a bigger concern I'm happy to do this.

As an aside, part of the reason is if I were assigned to refactor this, the first thing I would do is take any inlined subprocess invocations, extract them, and move them into this file.  Then I'd start combining them together.

You're totally right - inlining isn't right. üòÑ 

I guess the higher goal is to reduce to combinatorial explosion of ways to invoke a process in this file -- since these are all just lightweight wrappers around `processManager` calls anyway.  What if we embraced that wrapping and literally provided wrappers around the `ProcessManager` API, but with added named arguments with things like `bool traceCommand: true`?

If we did that, then caller code would look like:

```
flutterProcessManager.start(cmd, mode: ProcessStartMode.DETACHED_WITH_STDIO);
```

Thoughts?

Yep, while there's no way to know for sure that will work for all cases until we dive in, in principle that sounds good and matches with my intuition on what combining these together will wind up with.  I'll write up an extension of Ian's todo at the top of the file outlining that plan -- it seems like a bit too much surgery to try to do that in this PR.
üëç -- agreed that a separate PR makes sense.
dartdoc has been needing some love the last few days, will swing back around to this PR tomorrow
done
Can we get some tests that this does what we want it to?
Done.
check if this has already completed firstt
Yes, I do check on the line above.
